p: In the matter of Habeas Corpus

Petitioner was a free man of color who lived in Ohio; free for 16 years; manumitted in Hamilton County, Ohio, on February 13, 1840, by his owner, Exum Lewis, of Hinds County, Mississippi; copy of manumission from the Superior Court of Cincinnati; testimonies that he was free includes one from his father, Casey Kirk; committed by James A. Felps, a Justice of the Peace; petitioner informed the he will be
